profile.name: Julien PIRAT
profile.title: Gameplay Programmer & R&D Engineer
profile.subtitle: Unreal Engine Specialist | AI Systems | Multiplayer
profile.description: Passionate game developer specializing in gameplay programming, AI systems, and multiplayer networking with Unreal Engine. Currently working on Arcanthys with Ashen Bloom Studio.

projects.name: Arcanthys
projects.shortDescription: 3D/2D platformer for Android with Ashen Bloom Studio. Action, narrative, and exploration in a world shattered by magical catastrophe.
projects.fullDescription:
In a world torn apart by a magical catastrophe, the Silver Eclipse, magic itself has shattered, spawning chaos and monstrosities. From this cataclysm was born a unique entity, pure and luminous... you.

Arcanthys is a 3D/2D platformer on Android, blending action, narrative, and exploration. Each zone tells the story of the scars left by the Eclipse. It's an indie game with stylized, colorful graphics to contrast with the dark narrative universe.

As you progress, you'll unlock new magical powers, face creatures deformed by corruption, and encounter the remnants of forgotten civilizations.
contributions: Enemy AI behaviors: BehaviorTree, Blackboard, DetourCrowd
projects.technologies: Unreal Engine 5, C++, Blueprints, GAS, BehaviorTree, Perforce

projects.name: Green Rebirth
projects.shortDescription: Award-winning serious game from CREATE Game Jam 2024. Help fairies restore a dying forest in this environmental experience.
projects.fullDescription:
Green Rebirth was created during the CREATE Game Jam 2024 with a team of seven developers and one artist. It's a serious game with an environmental message where players have a few days to help little fairies restore a forest full of dead trees and trash.

The project was developed on Unreal Engine 5.4, primarily using Blueprints to optimize our time. We managed to scope appropriately for our skills, allowing us to dedicate time to polish.

projects.name: Clean Dream
projects.shortDescription: Multiplayer co-op game developed for the Ubisoft Competition 2024. Network replication and RPC implementation.
projects.fullDescription:
Clean Dream was developed for the Ubisoft Competition 2024 with a team of eight developers. It's a networked cooperative game built on Unreal Engine.

For team coordination, we used Discord and Jira, along with Perforce for version control. My main contribution focused on mole behavior implementation and bug fixing for both gameplay and networking.

This project taught me the importance of communication in a team, even with people you don't know. Working with Game Designers gave me insight into professional game development workflows.
projects.technologies: Unreal Engine, Blueprints, Networking/RPC, Perforce, Jira

projects.name: VRecycle
projects.shortDescription: VR serious game about waste sorting developed at UQAC. Educational experience raising awareness about recycling.
projects.fullDescription:
VRecycle is a university project involving a team of six developers. It's a serious game in virtual reality built on Unreal Engine. The goal is to raise awareness about waste sorting for a wide audience.

For coordination, we used Discord and Perforce for version control. My contributions focused on waste modeling, the sorting system for bins, and player movement.
contributions: All waste items implementation using GameplayTags
projects.technologies: Unreal Engine, VR, GameplayTags, Blueprints, Perforce

projects.name: TempleTrap
projects.shortDescription: 3D cooperative puzzle game with duel elements developed at UQAC. Rising water mechanics and respawn systems.
projects.fullDescription:
TempleTrap is a university project involving a team of four developers. It's a 3D cooperative game built on Unreal Engine.

For coordination, we used Discord and Perforce for version control. My contributions focused on the rising water at the end of levels, temporary and permanent player deaths, and artistic elements like torches and lighting.

projects.name: Vivaldi
projects.shortDescription: 3D roguelite with advanced AI systems using Behavior Trees and Environment Query System (EQS).
projects.fullDescription:
Vivaldi is a university project involving a team of seven developers. It's a 3D roguelite built on Unreal Engine.

For coordination, we used Teams and Discord, along with Perforce for version control. My contributions focused on AI implementation and bug fixing for both programming and artistic elements.
contributions: Two AI types: melee combat and ranged combat
projects.technologies: Unreal Engine, C++, Blueprints, BehaviorTree, EQS, Perforce

projects.name: TowerDefense
projects.shortDescription: Tower defense game built in C++ to improve Unreal Engine skills. Wave system using DataTables.
projects.fullDescription:
This personal project aimed to create a small system for positioning actors in a level. I continued developing it into a tower defense game to improve my skills when starting with Unreal Engine.

The project features a complete tower defense gameplay loop with turret placement, movement, and destruction, plus an enemy wave system using DataTables.

systems.name: DetourCrowd Navigation
systems.shortDescription: DetourCrowd system for improved navigation and dynamic avoidance between AI agents.
systems.fullDescription:
Implementation of Unreal Engine's DetourCrowd system to improve navigation and dynamic avoidance between AI agents. This system enables smoother and more realistic agent movement, especially in dense environments or during crowd crossings.

The system significantly improves the natural feel of AI movement when multiple agents need to navigate in the same area, preventing the common issues of agents getting stuck or moving through each other.

systems.name: AI Object Pooling
systems.shortDescription: AI pooling system for reusing agents instead of destroy/recreate cycles.
systems.fullDescription:
Implementation of an AI pooling system to reuse agents rather than destroying and recreating them at each spawn. This approach significantly reduces CPU cost and performance spikes during large-scale crowd testing.

The pooling system maintains a collection of pre-instantiated AI agents that can be activated and deactivated as needed, avoiding the expensive operations of spawning and destroying actors.

systems.name: Visual Logger Customization
systems.shortDescription: Customized Visual Logger for analyzing AI behavior during simulation.
systems.fullDescription:
Utilization and customization of Unreal Engine's Visual Logger to analyze AI behavior during simulation. This tool allows visualization of decisions, behaviors, and movements directly in the engine for faster and more precise debugging.

The custom implementation adds project-specific logging categories and visualization helpers that make it easier to understand complex AI decision-making processes.
